faq.headline: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subheadline: Answering your questions about physiotherapy and your recovery journey.
faq.q1.question: What should I expect on my first visit?
faq.q1.answer: Your first visit will include a comprehensive assessment of your condition, including a discussion of your medical history and a physical examination. We will then develop a personalized treatment plan tailored to your specific needs and goals.
faq.q2.question: Do I need a doctor's referral?
faq.q2.answer: In Israel, you do not need a doctor's referral to see a physiotherapist. You can book an appointment directly with us. However, if you plan to seek reimbursement from your Kupat Holim, a referral may be required.
faq.q3.question: How long does each session last?
faq.q3.answer: Each physiotherapy session typically lasts between 45 to 60 minutes, depending on your condition and treatment plan.
faq.q4.question: What should I wear to my appointment?
faq.q4.answer: Please wear comfortable, loose-fitting clothing that allows for easy movement and access to the area being treated.

testimonials.sarah.name: Sarah M.
testimonials.sarah.quote: Effie's expertise and personalized care made my post-surgery recovery remarkably smooth. I regained full mobility faster than expected!
testimonials.david.name: David L.
testimonials.david.quote: After months of chronic pain, Effie's evidence-based approach finally gave me relief. Professional, knowledgeable, and truly caring.
testimonials.rachel.name: Rachel K.
testimonials.rachel.quote: Effie's understanding of both the medical and emotional aspects of recovery was invaluable. Highly recommend for anyone seeking quality physiotherapy.
